text.div:
BC LateralityCS CodeSystem

Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest. Codes are from NCI

name: LateralityCS
title: BC LateralityCS CodeSystem
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest. Codes are from NCI

concept.definition: BILATERAL Affecting both sides of the body, or a pair of organs.
concept.display: BILATERAL Affecting both sides of the body, or a pair of organs.

concept.definition: CONTRALATERAL Having to do with the opposite side of the body, in relation to a pre-existing reference point.
concept.display: CONTRALATERAL Having to do with the opposite side of the body, in relation to a pre-existing reference point.

concept.definition: IPSILATERAL Having to do with the same side of the body, in relation to a pre-existing reference point.
concept.display: IPSILATERAL Having to do with the same side of the body, in relation to a pre-existing reference point.

concept.definition: LATERAL Situated at or extending to the side.
concept.display: LATERAL Situated at or extending to the side.

concept.definition: LEFT Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
concept.display: LEFT Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

concept.definition: RIGHT Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
concept.display: RIGHT Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

concept.definition: UNILATERAL Affecting one side of the body or one of a pair of organs.
concept.display: UNILATERAL Affecting one side of the body or one of a pair of organs.
